IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE QUALITY, COMPASSIONATE HEALTHCARE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE QUALITY, COMPASSIONATE HEALTHCARE.
IRS990.Description: Caldwell Medical Center provided inpatient, outpatient, and emergency care services to patients in Caldwell, Lyon, Trigg, Hopkins, and Crittenden counties. It also operated a home health agency and two clinics in the same geographical area. In addition, Caldwell Medical Center's major service accomplishments for the year were hosting a Community Health Fair, Community Flu Shot Clinic, Prostate Screenings, Blood Drives, Blood Pressure Screenings, Diabetes Counsil, Caldwell Cancer Council, and Run for Your Life 5K.

NameOfContractor.NamePerson: David French MD PSC Princeton KY

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Identifier: Organization's Direct and indirect political campaign activities
Form990ScheduleCPartIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCH. C, PART II-b, LINE 1I
Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: The organization makes indirect donations through AHA and KHA dues.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCH. C, PART II-III, LINE 1I
Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: A PERCENTAGE of AHA and KHA dues ARE USED for lobbying expenses.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: OTHER REVENUE ON RETURN NOT ON BOOKS: LOSS ON DISPOSAL OF ASSETS $(152,817)
OTHER EXPENSES ON BOOKS NOT ON RETURN: LOSS ON DISPOSAL OF ASSETS $(152,817)

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.IncomeBasedCriteria: Discounted care is not provided by Caldwell County Hospital.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CostingMethodUsed: Cost of Charity Care was calculated with a cost to charge ratio using worksheet 2. Cost of Medicaid was calculated with a cost to charge ratio using worksheet 3.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PercentOfTotalExpenseExpln: Bad Debts Included in Part IX, Line 25 totaled -$1,433,706. This amount has been removed from total expenses calculated in Column F on Schedule H, Part I and II.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: THE HOSPITAL PROVIDES AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS, WHICH IS BASED UPON A REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES, HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION AND EXISTING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS. PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE ORDINARILY DUE 30 DAYS AFTER THE ISSUANCE OF THE INVOICE. BALANCES PAST DUE MORE THAN 120 DAYS ARE CONSIDERED DELINQUENT. DELINQUENT RECEIVABLES ARE WRITTEN OFF BASED ON INDIVIDUAL CREDIT EVALUATION AND SPECIFIC CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE PAITENT OR THIRD-PARTY PAYER. CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER PROVIDED $1,349,225 UNCOMPENSATED CARE DURING THE YEAR. THE HOSPITAL USED THE COST-TO-CHARGE RATIO CALCULATED ON WORKSHEET 2 TO DETERMINE THE COST. CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER INCLUDES THIS AMOUNT AS A COMMUNITY BENEFIT DUE FOR TREATING PATIENTS FROM THE COMMUNITY WHO COULD NOT PAY FOR SERVICES.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER IS A CRITICAL ACCESS HOSPITAL AND IS REIMBURSED FROM MEDICARE AT 101% OF COST RELATED TO CARING FOR MEDICARE PATIENTS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: PATIENTS THAT QUALIFY FOR CHARITY NEVER ENTER INTO THE COLLECTION PRACTICES. THESE ACCOUNTS ARE WRITTEN OFF AS SOON AS THE PATIENT QUALIFIES FOR CHARITY.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER IS INFORMED OF THE NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY BUT DOES NOT CONDUCT A FULL COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT. CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER IS ALWAYS AVAILABLE IF A NEED ARISES AND ASSISTS OTHER COMMUNITY AGENCIES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: ANY UNINSURED PATIENT IS PROVIDED WITH INFORMATION ABOUT THE CHARITY CARE PROGRAM. CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER CONTRACTS WITH DISABILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES TO CONTACT EACH OF THE PATIENTS AND PROVIDE THEM WITH INFORMATION ON HOW TO GET QUALIFIED FOR MEDICAID OR THE CHARITY PROGRAM.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER'S PRIMARY SERVICE AREAS ARE CALDWELL AND LYON COUNTIES. CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER IS THE ONLY HOSPITAL LOCATED IN THESE COMMUNITIES. BOTH OF THESE COUNTIES ARE RURAL COMMUNITES AND ARE DESIGNATED AS HPSA'S. THE COMBINED POPULATION IS 21,000. THESE COMMUNITIES HAVE PER CAPITA INCOME LEVELS BELOW THE AVERAGE FOR KENTUCKY, AND BOTH ARE RANKED IN THE TOP 5% OF OLDERST AVERAGE AGE PER CAPITA. THESE COMMUNITIES HAVE OVER 4,200 LIVES COVERED BY THE MEDICAID PROGRAM.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS COMPRISED OF 14 COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS FROM THE SERVICE AREA. THE BOARD EXTENDS MEDICAL STAFF PRIVILEGES TO ALL QUALIFIED PHYSICIANS IN THE SERVICE AREA. CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER OPERATES AN ED THAT IS STAFFED 24/7 AND SERVES ALL PERSONS REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY. CALDWELL MEDICAL CENTER ALSO PARTICIPATES IN ALL GOVERNMENT SPONSORED HEALTH CARE PROGRAMS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE HOSPITAL HAS ESTABLISHED GUIDELINES FOR SCHOLARSHIP PARTICIPANTS TO FOLLOW. THESE GUIDELINES MUST BE FOLLOWED IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE ABILITY TO RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIP.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: SHANE WHITTINGTON AND CHARLES LOVELL, JR. ARE PAID FOR THEIR SERVICES TO CALDWELL COUNTY HOSPITAL THROUGH QUORUM HEALTH RESOURCES, LLC, A MANAGEMENT COMPANY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Delegation of control over management duties
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: form 990, part VI, Section A, Line 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Quorum Health Resource, LLC provides the CEO and CFO for Caldwell County Hospital, Inc.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 10
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS EMAILED TO EACH BOARD MEMBER PRIOR TO FILING. THE BOARD IS TO CONTACT ADMINISTRATION IF THEY HAVE ANY CONCERNS OR QUESTIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Process for determining compensation - CEO and CFO
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Directors reviews CEO and CFO compensation on a yearly basis.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Process for determining compensation - Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Directors have to approve all physician compensation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Documents not made available to the public
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization does not make its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Monitoring of the conflict of interest policy
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: form 990, part VI, Section B, Line 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH EMPLOYEE AND BOARD MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY EACH YEAR. THE BOARD AND ADMINISTRATION RELY ON SELF REPORTING TO MONITOR COMPLIANCE.
